description:
Crime has risen to unprecedented levels. Criminal organizations have banded together - all under the leadership of Hector Vasquez, the mastermind behind it all.

It is up to Joe Baxter and Michael Dvorak, tough cops from New York and Chicago respectively, to eliminate all the goons and henchmen of the mobs until they can go after Vasquez himself - with whom the two have a personal beef they'd love to settle.

The game itself is a side-scrolling shoot-'em-up that can be played with one or two players simultaneously, and is very similar to Narc. In five major US cities, all the enemies must be taken out using different weapons like flame throwers, tazers, uzis, rocket launchers, and grenades.
title: Task Force

description:
A mouse-driven shoot-em-up which was only ever released for the Apple IIgs. The player controls a red helicopter which must defend an escaping convoy of ships at the bottom of the screen. This convoy is under constant attack from incoming gunboats, torpedoes, and the like.

Gameplay consists primarily of destroying incoming hazards by shooting them down; a limited number of immolation charges are also available, which set the player's helicopter on fire for a short period of time, which causes it to destroy anything it touches. The game ends when either all the player's ships or helicopters are destroyed.
title: Sea Strike

description:
In Alien Mind, players take on the role of biologist and physicist, Timothy Hunter. Timothy has been called upon by his friend Aaron Avery to visit the research space station Zekford in order to partake in the study of two recently discovered, unhatched eggs of unknown origin. Upon arrival, Hunter soon realizes that all is not well on the space station Zekford.

Zekford has been overrun with hostile aliens--the bodies of the research scientists lying strewn about the halls. Timothy must blast his way through the hordes of enemies and solve the puzzles contained in the data left in the station's central computer system in order stop the second alien from hatching and to save his friend.

The game plays mostly as a top-down arcade shooter. The player must stay alive and interface with the various computer terminals throughout the level. These terminals provide the player with clues that allow the player to access new sections of the level. The clues come in the form of riddles that reference both the objects in the game and the back story contained in the game's manual.

sample_screenshots.caption: Roaming around on a vehicle of some kind

title: Alien Mind

description:
In Tower of Myraglen, the player must make it through the tower to retrieve a medallion while also defeating an evil king. The Medallion, a soul stealing artifact, was created by the young prodigy magician named Mendalick. The medallion made Mendalick age. Being too feeble to use it himself, he hid it in a rock of the Tower of Myraglen.

After some time a king had an adventurer enter the tower to retrieve the medallion for him under the guise of it being for everyone's safety. The king then killed the adventurer and established himself as a despot of the land in the tower.

Throughout the game the player has to find clues, fight monsters, and make decisions of both moral and strategic nature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Be wary of the paths you choose!
Make sure you bring a present!
The game just loves to mock you in any way it can

title: Tower of Myraglen

description:
In Great Western Shootout the player takes the role of the Lone Lawman who is on a mission to clean up his town from criminals.

It's a shooting gallery game played from a first person perspective without movement. The player moves a crosshair with the mouse and has to shoot the villains as they peek out from behind cover. If he takes too long the enemies will instead shoot him, leading to a loss of health. At the same time the player has to watch out for civilians. If these are shot, some health will be lost, too. To regain health the player has to shoot the medicine bags that appear on the screen for brief moments. Keeping track of ammo is also important as once it's been used it takes some time to reload.

For each outlaw killed the player earns 15 gold and at the end of the game the player might reach a high score. The game can be played by one or two players. In two player mode players take turns playing each level.
title: Great Western Shootout

description: Two Marines find themselves under the power of an evil alien presence on a planet they are attempting to survey. It is a classic platform game of climbing ladders, collecting energy chips, and avoiding dangerous aliens. The chips are glowing green and give the player energy and life points. Other power ups give the player the power to teleport across a level, freeze an enemy, or jump to the next level. Viewed as a 3rd person shooter, Laser Force is presented in an isometric point of view. It also allows for two player action, by placing one player on the keyboard, and the other on the joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen, where you can choose between game and level editor

title: Laser Force

description:
LemminGS is an unlicensed port of Lemmings for the Apple IIGS.

The graphics were pulled from the Atari ST version, the midi music from the PC version, and sound effects from the Macintosh version. The ST version was also used as a general reference with some added improvements, the original game scripts by DMA Design could not be used.

This version of the game has 92 Levels, unlike the original official 16bit computer versions which have 120.
title: LemminGS

description:
Talking U.S.A. Map is an educational game that teaches geography. When starting out the player is presented with a map of the United States that is divided into four regions with different colours. Clicking on a region brings up a close up of it where any of the states can be clicked on. Doing so brings up a topographic map of the state along with three different buttons. Clicking on these will show various trivia and factual information about the state.

The program also contains a quiz where the player is asked questions about the state capitals. The states will appear one at a time and the capital has to be typed in. The player has two tries and the quiz goes on until all capitals have been asked for. The score given is a percentage of questions answered correctly.

Although the game is described as talking, only the names of the states are actually spoken.

sample_screenshots.caption: Click on name to show entrance date

title: Talking U.S.A. Map

description:
Geographic Jigsaw USA is an educational game that consists of four activities, including two games: Jigsaw and Map Quiz. In addition to these there is Map Facts which is an interactive map of the USA where the user can click on any of the states and get various data (capital, area, population etc.) and Stat Maps which consists of a number of non-interactive statistical maps showing for example population density or energy usage.

Jigsaw works like other jigsaw puzzle games but here the pieces are the states of the USA. The player's task is simply to click on a state and drag it to the right place on the map. There are three difficulty levels that alter the gameplay. On the easy and medium levels the states' outlines are shown on the map which they are not on the hard one. Medium and hard difficulties also have some states that needs to be rotated to fit. When a state has successfully been put in place, its name and capital will be displayed on the easy level while on the medium level the names has to be entered by the player and on the hard level both has to be entered.

Map Quiz asks questions to the player and the player has to click on the correct state on the map. Different categories can be chosen depending on difficulty levels, including capitals, cities, landmarks, features and history.
title: Geographic Jigsaw USA

description:
Monte Carlo is a collection of seven gambling games that can be played at the Casino de Monte-Carlo:

  • Baccarat
  • Black Jack
  • Craps
  • Poker
  • Roulette
  • Slots
  • Trente-et-Quarante

The game can be played by one or two players who start out with $5000 in cash which can be spent in any of the games. The game is entirely played with the mouse and to bet the players simply drag chips into the betting area. Once the chips have been placed a game is started by pressing the deal, roll or spin button depending on the game. If a player wins the money is automatically added to his cash total. It's possible to cash out at any time and the player's name might then be added to the high score list of big rollers.
title: Monte Carlo

description:
Ancient Glory is a side scrolling action game based on Greek mythology. It is based on the adventures of Hercules who the player controls as he travels the Greek countryside (as well as some other locations in the Mediterranean) in his quest to defeat the gorgon Medusa. To do so five magical items have to be collected which is done by completing tasks for Hermes and Athena. At the same time Hercules has to be aware of the wrath of Hera, who will try to stop him. Time is limited as the player only has seventeen days of in-game time to complete the quest.

The game starts out in Thebes with an unarmed Hercules who has to use his feet to kick at the scorpions that attack him. Weapons can be collected such as a club, a sword and a bow (which is given to Hercules by Athena when visiting Athens) which are needed to defeat animals such as lions, bulls and snakes as well as mythological creatures such as molionids and minotaurs. Levels are linear and involve moving from left to right but can be played in any order although locations that are farther away take a longer time to travel to.
title: Ancient Glory

description:
Talking Cloze Technique: Greek Mythology is an educational game that teaches reading in context. It contains eight stories adapted from various Greek myths. Each story consists of multiple pages of text which are accompanied with pictures that can be clicked on to start a brief animation. On each page there are two omitted words that the student should fill in. Clicking on the blanks will lead to an animated owl called Mo Mentum appearing who will offer a choice of three words. Clicking on the right one will allow the student to continue with the story. After filling in all the words a score will be given and if more than 75% of the answers were correct the student will be awarded with a golden key.

The myths included are:

  • Daedalus and Icarus
  • Jason and Medea
  • Odysseus
  • Heracles
  • Perseus and Medusa
  • Theseus and the Minotaur
  • Persephone and Pluto
  • Pandora
title: Talking Cloze Technique: Greek Mythology

description: Hover Blade is an action game that uses a chase view similar to Buck Rogers: Planet of Zoom and Space Harrier. The game involves steering a hovercraft with the mouse as it automatically moves forward and the objective is to reach the end without crashing. The path ahead is full of various obstacles such as trees, bushes and structures which has to be avoided since collisions leads to a loss of power. When all out of power the craft will be destroyed. The craft also has a limited amount of fuel and it's necessary to collect fuel canisters to refill. Missiles can be used to destroy obstacles but come in limited supply. To recharge the missiles the craft has to fly through a black sphere. The player will also come across gates that when flown through gives bonus points once a level has been completed.
title: Hover Blade

description:
Gnarly Golf is a mini golf game that consists of eighteen holes, none of which looks or behaves much like real life mini golf. Each hole is a single screen in size and is viewed from a top down perspective. Locations include a pool hall, a prison and the roof of a skyscraper and often involve a puzzle element where the player has to figure out how to reach the hole.

The game is entirely played with the mouse and uses a three click process to launch a shot. The first click is for choosing the direction to aim in and a circular swing meter will then appear. An indicator on the meter shows the direction and a second indicator will start moving backwards. The second click decides the power of the swing with maximum force being applied when the indicator goes all the way back. The third click sets the spin of the ball which then will be released.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moving on to the second hole

title: Gnarly Golf

description:
Cavern Cobra is a shoot 'em up that is similar to Scramble but with no scrolling. A dangerous terrorist has built his base in a underground network of caverns in Tibet and it is the player's task to infiltrate his facilities and defeat the terrorist.

The player flies an advanced helicopter called the Cavern Cobra which is used to navigate through the caverns, one screen at a time. The helicopter is equipped with four different weapons: a machine gun that shoots regular bullets, bombs that are dropped on enemies, grenades that are launched in an arc and fire fragmentation bombs which when activated splits into fragments. Like in Defender it's possible to turn the helicopter around and fly in the opposite direction. Based on how many enemies are destroyed the player earns points and bonuses. Bonuses include ammunition that is given for destroyed trucks, armor that is given for destroyed towers and fuel that is given for destroyed fuel tanks. Enemy kinds include bunkers, gun balloons, gunners, radars and different variants of mines and missiles.

sample_screenshots.caption: This screen appear every time you leave a screen
This helipad leads to the next level (if you're able to land on it)

title: Cavern Cobra

alternate_titles.title: Mazer II: The Ghost of Mordaine

description:
Mazer II is a first person shooter with puzzle solving elements. The player enters a strange place called Mazeworld and is immediately greeted by an invisible character called George who is being attacked by a very large cat. George acts as a guide in the world but the exact purpose or goal of the game is never made fully clear and it's up to the player to explore the world. Various strange creatures inhabit the world some are hostile and have to be killed while others are friendly and can be talked to.

The game entirely uses the mouse to move around and interact with the world. Interaction is done by firing energy pulses which there are four types of: creative, destructive, affirmative and negative. Creative energy is used for expressing friendly intentions while destructive energy is used for killing enemies. Affirmative energy is used to say yes while negative energy is used for saying no. All uses of the different energy types are not explain and it's up to the player to figure out.

sample_screenshots.caption: This passage seem to be blocked by two lava lamps
Being attacked by an enormous rat

title: Mazer II

description:
Talking Addition & Subtraction is an educational game for children ages five to eight that teaches math using only the numerals one to ten. The game contains four different activities: * Sets and Numbers: The player is asked to type a number between one and ten and will then hear the number spoken, see it written as numeral and word and as a set of objects corresponding with the number.

  • Picture Problems: The player is presented with ten problems to solve and simply has to enter the correct answer. Two tries are allows for each problem.
  • Working with a Number Line: The screen shows a number line with a frog and the player has to click on the number corresponding to the problem given to make the frog jump there. Each problem has two steps and two tries are allowed.
  • Coloring through Math: The player is presented with the outline of a picture where each segment has a number. As problems are given the player has to click on the segment with the corresponding number. Answering correctly leads to that segment being coloured.
title: Talking Addition & Subtraction

description: Talking Speller is an educational game for children ages five to eight. The game is divided into four activities with each existing in easy and hard versions. The first three, travel words, clothing words and outdoor words, all work the same. A picture of a landscape appears with objects being drawn one at a time. The name of the object is spoken and the player has to type it in correctly. Answering correctly leads to the next word being drawn. If stuck the player can click on a help button to reveal the next letter. The fourth activity is called word scramble and reviews the words learned. The word will here appear with letters scrambled but the player still has to just type the word in like before.
title: Talking Speller

description:
Milestones 2000 is an adaptation of the card game Mille Bornes. It is a remake of the author's Apple II game Milestones and like that version it is for one player competing against an AI opponent. It has all new graphics and an interface that uses the mouse to drag cards onto side view images of the cars. Most of the rules stay the same but with some modifications. Each race is 1500 kilometres which can be extended to 2000. By extending the race the player can earn additional bonus points. The game ends when one player goes above a total of 5000 points.

The player has access to seven cards and can for each turn either play or discard one card. There are four types of cards: distance, problem, fix and power cards. Distance cards are used to drive the amount of miles listed on them but require that a go card is played first. Problem cards are used to prevent the movement of the opponent who has to play a corresponding fix card followed by a go card before being able to play a distance card again. For example, the repair card fixes the accident card and the spare tire fixes the flat tire. Power cards when played make the player immune to the corresponding problem cards.

sample_screenshots.caption: I have a speed limit but plays the end limit card to remove it
The landscape changes the further we drive

title: Milestones 2000

description:
Bouncing Bluster is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the Apple IIgs.

The player controls a paddle on the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally, and must bounce a ball to hit and destroy and bricks on the screen. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost. Various powerups fall from the screen as blocks are broken, including multiple balls, the ability to shoot lasers, sticky balls, and thinner/wider paddles.
title: Bouncing Bluster

description:
Dueltris is a 1 - 2 player competitive Tetris clone for the Apple IIgs.

Different shaped blocks fall from the top of the screen, and the player must align them in rows. When a row is completed, the line is deleted. If the blocks reach the top of the screen, it's game over. Players can also receive bombs and guns that destroy a few blocks. Both players' play screens are displayed simultaneously. During competitive play, the player can compete against a computer of different difficulty, or another human opponent.
title: Dueltris

description:
2088: The Cryllan Mission is a science fiction themed RPG for Apple IIgs.

The U.S.S. Houston and its crew have crashed on the alien Cryllan planet. The planet and their 6-member team have been dispatched by the Strategic Defense Division of NSEC to investigate. Upon arriving on the planet, the player finds that the crew of the U.S.S. Houston have overthrown the passive Cryllan civilization and set themselves up as leaders of the planet. The player must restore the planet to its original order.

Game play is from a top-down perspective, where the player can move about the surface of the planet, as well as enter towns and talk to the various inhabitants. The player can shop at various stores. Combat occurs on a 9 x 9 combat field based upon player terrain. The player can move all 6 of their characters independently, or can have the computer automate combat. The player is armed with a map and alien scanner to locate enemy creatures and other geography. Players can level up, and purchase improved armor and weapons. Dungeons are explored from a 1st person perspective.
title: 2088: The Cryllan Mission

description:
Fun Columns is a Columns clone for the Apple IIgs.

The player drops blocks vertical columns containing 3 different colors, which can be rotated. If the player aligns 3 blocks of the same color, the pieces disappear, and the blocks drop. If the blocks reach the top of the play area, it's game over. There are 6 levels of difficulty.
title: Fun Columns

description:
Cosmocade: The Arcade of Tomorrow contains 2 separate arcade games for the Apple IIgs.

  • Journey to Calibus: The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, and fires directly forward. As alien ships are destroyed, they drop a number of power ups. Some of these power-ups contain maps which fill in the screen in the bottom left, allowing the player to advance to the next level when completely filled. The goal is to return to Earth, and there are 10 levels in total. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
  • Naxos: Played from a first person perspective, the player must shoot alien creatures as they appear on the screen. If the aliens are allowed to shoot, the player takes damage. The player has limited ammo, and must continually reload. The player has a health bar, and when all health is depleted, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Journey to Calibus - Taking Heavy Damage

title: Cosmocade: The Arcade of Tomorrow

description:
Gate is a top-down arcade game for the Apple IIgs.

You have been captured by Darg the Firemaster, and thrown into prison. While locked in prison, you meet a dying prisoner, who gifts you a key to escape your cell in exchange for trying to defeat the Firemaster.

The player is armed with a sword and must explore the twisting corridors of the Firemaster's prison from a top-down perspective. They must defeat his multitude of guards who constantly move towards the player. Guards spawn from set points which must be destroyed. The player has limited health, and when all is lost , a life is lost. The player can purchase health, keys, and armor from magic shops encountered throughout levels. The player collects treasures and different colored keys as they explore, and there are multiple levels to explore.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Notice in a Jail Cell

title: Gate

description:
Orbizone is a 1-player arcade game for the Apple IIgs.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate and accelerate in all directions, and can fire directly forwards. The player encounters a number of asteroids that break into smaller pieces when shot, with the goal to destroy all asteroids on the screen. The ship can accelerate to avoid dangers and pick up bonus items that drop during gameplay. The player starts with 5 ships, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Orbizone

description:
One Arm Battle is a 1 - 4 player slots game for the Apple IIgs.

The player has 6 turning wheels representing different potential slots rewards. Each turn, the player picks a goal, which defines how that turn will play out. After each spin, the player chooses a number of wheels to lock, with the purpose to meet that turn's goal for bonus points. The first player to reach 5000 points is the winner. The player defines which players are human and computer controlled.
title: One-Arm Battle

description:
Plunder! is a 1 - 4 player board game for the Apple IIgs.

Players are brought into a room where a number of bag, treasure chests, and boxes are located. Containers possess cash prizes, bombs, or special modifiers that modify the amount of cash or bombs in the room. Each player takes turns picking a container, which adds cash to the total pool between the players. A player can chose to leave the room at any time with their share of the total cash prize. If a player selects a package with an explosive, all players left in the room lose all their money, and the players are moved to the next room.

The first player to reach the specified money threshold is the winner.
title: Plunder!

description:
Quest for the Hoard is a 1 - 2 player puzzle game for the Apple IIgs.

The player selects blocks on a 26 x 17 board. Game play is timed, and the player must attempt to locate the treasure and vaults located on each board before time expires. As the player searches, if they are within 2 squares of a treasure, the area becomes highlighted, and the player gains points by highlighting the dangerous square with a spell of protection. A vault must be directly found my selecting it's block. If a level is cleared, the player progresses to a more difficult challenge. There are 14 levels of difficulty, which define the starting challenge.
title: Quest for the Hoard

description:
The Secrets of Bharas is a fantasy themed RPG for Apple IIgs.

The six great lands of Bharas lay in isolation from each other for many years until adventurous human sailors from Surya learned to traverse the ocean waves and established communications with the other lands, including the lands of the Dwarves and Elves. It is the discovery of magic in two separate lands that leads to a great conflict between the races. Eventually over 200 years, 3 more great conflicts ensue, until finally peace is restored between the lands. Now after 2 years of peace, the player's band of adventurers learn that King Narayan's latest peace envoy has gone missing. The players must discover and stop whomever is trying to lead the lands into conflict once again.

Game play is from a top-down perspective, where the player can move about the surface of the planet, as well as enter towns and talk to the various inhabitants via text entry. The player can shop at various stores. Combat occurs on a 9 x 9 combat field based upon player terrain. The player can move all 6 of their characters independently, or can have the computer automate combat. Players can level up, and purchase improved armor and weapons. The player has mages and healers who can cast powerful magic spells. Dungeons are explored from a 1st person perspective.
title: The Secrets of Bharas

description:
Sensei is a 1 - 2 player karate game for the Apple IIgs.

The player controls a player during a 1 on 1 fight against their opponent. Each match is timed, and the player who scores the most points during the match, or causes their opponent to lose all health is the winner. Players can jump, duck, and throw a number of punches and kicks. When the player challenges the computer opponent, they start on a white belt opponent and progress to more difficult challenges and higher belts.
title: Sensei

description:
Space Clusters is a 1-player arcade game for the Apple IIgs.

The player controls a small spaceship which scrolls horizontally along the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. The player must combat with swarms of alien space vessels which move towards the player and fire at them in waves. There are a total of progressively more difficulty 50 levels. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Space Clusters

description:
Space Fox is a 1-player side-scrolling space shooter for the Apple IIgs.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move in all directions and fires forwards, as they fight their way through a number of progressively more difficult alien levels. Enemy ships approach in waves, and when one group is destroyed, typically powerups are dropped, which include fuel, shields, and more powerful weapons. The player has limited fuel for each level, and if this runs out, a life is lost. Each level has a final boss battle, and a supply depot, which the player can dock with to load a new weapon or purchase other supplies. The ship is also armed with a limited shield supply, which can be used to temporarily make the vessel invulnerable to alien attack.
title: Space Fox

description:
Space Shark is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the Apple IIgs.

Hello Captain. As you know, we are under a new alien invasion coming from Iru Bom Maz, the only planet which hasn't signed the International Peace Treaty. Your mission is to kill all the aliens approaching our solar system.

The player controls a small space ship which can move in all directions on a field that horizontally scrolls left and right. The player can shoot horizontally. Each level has a set number of alien vessels that must be destroyed to progress to the next level. Vessels track invariably towards the player, and the player loses a life if hit. The player starts with 6 vessels, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Space Shark

description:
As The Link Turns: Operation Bug is a 1-player arcade shooter for the Apple IIgs.

The situation is grave. The future of the Apple IIgs lies in the your hands. An evil force has infiltrated Applelink and released a horde of malevolent entities on the grounds. The members of Applelink have so far been quarantined within the mall. but will not be safe much longer

Your mission is to clear the area of the creatures and save Applelink and the Apple II. The enemies have a very low staying power being ex-Mac user and will be easily destroyed. The player is armed with a special antigravity bodysuit with an Apple II overlay for viewing area. This suit will automatically eject the player after 2 minutes and 15 seconds. The player controls a crosshair, and must destroy as many enemies in that time as possible. Enemies include bugs, ram chips, and angry appearing disks.
title: As The Link Turns: Operation Bug

description:
Stars & Planets is a single-player educational game for the Apple IIgs.

Contains 6 educational mini-games:* Match the image of a planet with the correct planet in a list.

  • Complete an image of a space vessel by selecting different parts of it
  • Collect the number of items displayed on a space lander
  • Place a planet in the correct space on an image of the planets with several missing
  • Match a constellation with the picture of the stars
  • Match the name of a planet with an image of the planet
title: Stars & Planets

description:
Tarot is a 1 - 4 player French tarot card game for the Apple IIgs.

French Tarot is played with a deck consisting of 78 playing cards. The game consists of the player competing against three opponents with the objective being to accumulate enough card points to win the hand by taking tricks
title: Tarot

description:
2088: The Cryllan Mission - The Second Scenario is a second stand alone version of 2088: The Cryllan Mission.

The game opens with the same premise as the original scenario: the crew of the U. S. S. Houston are missing on the planet Crylla. The plot is entirely different from the original scenario, and the geography of the planet has been changed. Contains several upgrades to the viewing window.
title: 2088: The Cryllan Mission - The Second Scenario
